intro: Seseli heterophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is native to regions of western North America. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Seseli heterophyllum is often found in open woodlands and along dry streambeds.
